Package Project3

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Project3.Controller
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
The Controller class is used to control the Payroll Processor GUI and implement all the methods of Company.
Author:
Srija Gottiparthi, Catherine Nguyen

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Initializes the controller with the relationships between the selected employment type and its applicable text fields.

    • add

      void add​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Adds a new Employee to the database after checking that all fields are correctly filled in and valid.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Add Employee" button getting clicked

    • remove

      void remove​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Removes an Employee from the database after checking that all fields are correctly filled in and valid.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Remove Employee" button getting clicked

    • setHours

      void setHours​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Sets hours for the specified part-time employee after checking that the appropriate fields are correctly filled in and valid.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Set Hours" button getting clicked

    • clear

      void clear​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Clears all fields and radio button selections.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Clear" button getting clicked

    • calcPayments

      void calcPayments​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Calculates payments for all employees in the company.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Calculate Payments" option under the "Payments" menu on the Menu Bar is selected

    • importDatabase

      void importDatabase​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Prompts the user to select a database (a formatted text file) to import.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Import" option under the "File" menu on the Menu Bar is selected

    • export

      void export​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Prompts the user to export the database to a formatted text file.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Export" option under the "File" menu on the Menu Bar is selected

    • print

      void print​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Prints the database in its current form to the Text Area.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Print" option under the "Print" menu on the Menu Bar is selected

    • printByDate

      void printByDate​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Prints the database in order of date hired to the Text Area.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Print by Date Hired" option under the "Print" menu on the Menu Bar is selected

    • printByDept

      void printByDept​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Prints the database in alphabetical order of department to the Text Area.
      Parameters:
      event - the "Print by Department" option under the "Print" menu on the Menu Bar is selected
